Have to start with @WarrenBuffett and Berkshire Hathaway: "Take the probability of loss times the amount of possible loss from the probability of gain times the amount of possible gain. That is what we’re trying to do. It’s imperfect, but that’s what it’s all about."

The idea is this: the market (say, S&P 500) does what it does in a particular year. For every dollar of outperformance, there has to be a corresponding dollar of underperformance (before fees). That’s all the analogy says.
